summary:
**Meeting Overview**:  
The Economic Development Committee of the Dallas City Council will convene on June 3, 2024, at 1:00 PM in the Council Chambers, City Hall. This meeting will address various economic development initiatives and budgetary considerations impacting the city.

**Key Agenda Items**:  
1. Approval of minutes from the May 6, 2024, meeting.
2. Launch of the Commercial Permitting Dashboard.
3. Presentations on the budgets for the Office of Economic Development and Development Services Department.
4. Discussion of the Power & Light Mixed-Income Redevelopment Project.
5. Update on the Master Plan for the Kay Bailey Hutchison Convention Center.
6. Proposed amendments to the Economic Development Corporation (EDC) Bylaws.
7. Updates on permitting and hiring within the Development Services Department.
8. Proposed 2025 Federal Legislative Updates.
9. Economic Impact Study regarding the Dallas to Fort Worth High-Speed Rail.

**Important Details**:  
Significant proposals include the redevelopment project on S. Ervay Street and amendments to the EDC Bylaws, which may affect future economic initiatives. Budget presentations will provide insights into funding allocations for economic development efforts.

**Action Items**:  
The committee seeks approval for the minutes from the previous meeting and will discuss various proposals, including the redevelopment project and EDC Bylaw amendments, to guide future economic strategies. The meeting may also involve closed sessions to discuss sensitive legal and financial matters.
